hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition via 20D/50D SMA Death Cross with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 55%), a bearish regime transition is signaled when BTC's 20-day SMA crosses below its 50-day SMA, accompanied by a 5-day average volume spike exceeding the 30-day average by 25% and a simultaneous 3-day RSI(14) decline below 45. This pattern predicts a transition to a BEAR regime within the next 10 trading days with >70% accuracy.
hypothesis_content.rationale: NEUTRAL regimes represent equilibrium states vulnerable to breakdown. The SMA death cross with elevated volume indicates institutional distribution, while RSI decline confirms momentum shift. ETH underperformance suggests risk-off rotation from altcoins to BTC, then out of crypto entirely.
entry_conditions: BTC 20D SMA < BTC 50D SMA (cross occurred within last 2 days)
BTC 5-day avg volume > BTC 30-day avg volume * 1.25
BTC RSI(14) < 45 and declining for 3 consecutive days

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to BEAR (confidence > 65%) OR 8% price decline from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims 20D SMA and closes above it for 2 consecutive days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such signals fail to produce a BEAR regime transition within 10 days, OR false signals occur when VIX term structure is in backwardation (indicating equity market stress already priced).
